questions.question: How many dihedral scans involving the backbone atoms can you do for n-pentane?

explanations.a: A dihedral angle includes 4 consecutive atoms. 1 dihedral angle would mean the molecule has 4 backbone atoms only.
explanations.b: N-pentane has 5 atoms, meaning there are two sets of 4 consecutive C atoms. Hence you can do 2 dihedral angle scans.
explanations.c: 3 dihedral angle scan would require 6 atoms to be present, which would be the case of hexane.
explanations.d: Since the molecule pentane contains 5 atoms which is more than required for one single dihedral angle, the possible dihedral scans cannot be zero.

questions.question: Why does the dihedral angle scan of butane have two symmetrical dips but ethane and propane have all dips symmetrical?

answers.a: Butane is symmetric while propane and ethane are not.
answers.b: Ethane and propane are more symmetric than butane.
answers.c: Butane has gauche interaction which is missing in ethane and propane.
answers.d: Butane is larger in size than the other two.

explanations.a: Both ethane and butane are symmetric to the same extent.
explanations.b: Propane is less symmetric than butane.
explanations.c: Butane dihedral scan has two CH3 groups attached which interact and produce two dips, while this kind of interaction is missing in smaller molecules like ethane and propane.
explanations.d: Butane, though, is larger than the other two but this does not imply two symmetrical dips, as would not be observed in higher homologues.

questions.question: The peaks in the torsion angle scan for butadiene are higher than peaks in butane. This is because:

answers.a: Butadiene has partial double bond character in its central C-C bond due to resonance.
answers.b: Central C-C bond in butadiene is a complete double bond.
answers.c: Butane is lower in energy due to all bonds being sigma bonds.
answers.d: Gauche interaction is much more in butadiene than in butane.

explanations.a: Due to resonance, the central C-C bond attains partial double bond character and rotation across it would mean a loss of this resonance and hence the energy increases.
explanations.b: Central C-C bond in butadiene has a partial double bond.
explanations.c: More bonds mostly indicate lower energy and more stabilization which in this case would be that of butadiene.
explanations.d: Both have a similar amount of gauche interaction and should therefore have a similar rise in energy.

questions.question: Conformations are different arrangements of atoms that can be converted into one another by rotation about:

explanations.a: Though conformational isomerism exists in systems which have covalently bonded atoms across which rotation takes place, the strength of the bonds play a key role too. Mere covalent bond does not imply they will have different conformations.
explanations.b: Double bonded atoms are difficult to rotate and would require very high energy and mostly do not show rotation across the double bond.
explanations.c: Conformational isomerism is a form of stereoisomerism in which the isomers can be interconverted exclusively by rotations about formally single bonds.
explanations.d: Triple bonded atoms do not show rotation across them.
